file_content.text: Glad you, um, found what you needed.
That, um, signal device is in the Migrant Merchants' section. G--good luck.
Jedi! Welcome--welcome to the, uh, old Galactic Market, uh, sir.
Hmph. Soft thing can barely speak.
I'm sorry, I just--I never met a real Jedi up close.
I'm a person, just like you.
We're nothing special.
With respect, I'm here about your prisoner.
Let's focus on the Gand.
I could certainly get used to being a celebrity.
I don't mind the attention.
Um, right. Yes. Well, anyway.
This is the, uh, Gand we brought in. He was talking about that Jedi "holocron" you're all looking for. But he's not exactly, uh, talkative.
Sadness to have been captured. Should have fought harder.
This Gand won't speak to you or to anyone.
You refer to yourself as "Gand." How interesting.
No name?
The Gand do not speak their names except when they have earned it. This Gand has not earned it.
This is your chance to distinguish yourself--help me save a dying woman by telling me where the special holocron is.
You can earn a name right now.
This Gand would like to earn his name... but he has no wish to betray his fellow Gand.
I promise no harm will come to the Gand.
It'll be fine. I swear.
If you keep being uncooperative, what happens the next time Republic security arrests a Gand?
Being silent only hurts them.
This Gand hadn't considered this. He will tell what he can.
You will tell me about the holocron.
[Force Persuade] Help me.
Give me the holocron you're hiding, or things will get unpleasant.
My demands are simple.
You will tell me about the holocron.
[Force Persuade] You'll speak.
This Gand will tell you about the holocron.
I need the holocron. I suggest you cooperate before I get impatient.
Then we have a problem.
This Gand is weak and cowardly, but he is not afraid of threats.
Work with me and you can go free.
I just want answers.
How does this Gand know you will keep your word?
My word is my honor.
I am a Jedi.
All right. This Gand guesses that he has no choice. He'll tell you what he knows.
Will credits convince you?
I can pay you.
This Gand could use money. It is hard to come by... okay, he will tell you what he knows.
If you don't help me, the Republic will just keep you here. You won't see your people again.
I'm your only way out.
This Gand sees he has no choice. He will tell.
Gand, I have no wish to hurt you. But I must get that holocron. By any means necessary.
Please don't make me do this.
This Gand can see you will not change your mind. He will tell.
The Force can do terrible things to a person, Gand. Do you want a demonstration?
You should fear my power.
No! This Gand... this Gand will tell you what he knows.
The man called Lars Baddeg brought the holocron to the Gand's leader, Aulus G'luun, and told him to keep it safe.
Who is this "Lars Baddeg"?
Lars Baddeg?
This Gand doesn't know. He only knows the orders Aulus G'luun has given.
Where is the holocron now?
Tell me its location.
The holocron belongs to the Jedi.
It wasn't his to give.
Aulus G'luun has ordered the Gand to keep the holocron away from the Jedi.
Some days, Aulus G'luun holds it; some days, the ones who have earned one name; and some days, cowards like this Gand.
Is there some sort of schedule that determines who holds it?
How do you know who and when?
Just tell me where it is now.
So who has it today?
This Gand doesn't know. There is no schedule.
Why haven't the Gand tried to move the holocron off of Coruscant?
Why play such a game?
The Republic has barricaded the Migrant Merchants' Guild. It is not possible for this Gand or any other to leave.
The signal device in the market tells the Gand when to move the holocron and where.
This Gand has heard that one of the signals is for Aulus G'luun himself. The holocron always changes hands behind the warehouse.
This Gand doesn't know the signals, only that when the first signal is raised, the Gand meet behind the warehouse and he sometimes gets the holocron.
So I must light the signal, then go to the warehouse.
I understand.
I appreciate your help.
That seems excessively complicated.
Not very efficient.
I'll bet the signals have something to do with the Gand hierarchy. Throw up the right one, and you'll get their leader.
Yes. Please don't tell anyone what this Gand told you.
Sorry. I should keep an eye on my prisoner.
Oh! Jedi! You're back! Did you need something?
The Gand are not criminals, and yet they're being held against their will.
This barricade harms the Gand.
Well, we try not to let anyone through because of the criminal, uh, criminal elements, sir. I mean, Jedi.
But I guess if a Jedi says so, we can make an exception--for the Gand, I mean.
I'd appreciate it if you made that exception.
Please.
What are you waiting for?
A Jedi says so.
I suppose this place is safer with the barricade up.
Actually, don't bother.
A--all right, then. We'll keep the barricade in place.
No, just checking in.
Carry on.
Well, it's a--always a pleasure. Take care.
The Gand are involved in highly illegal activities. A roundup might be in order.
Arrest all the Gand.
Y--yes, sir. I mean, Jedi. I mean, I'll report it to the head of security. We'll get on it right away.
